description: Gets details about a particular identity pool, including the pool name, ID description, creation date, and current number of users. You must use Amazon Web Services developer credentials to call this operation.

parameters.name: IdentityPoolId
parameters.description: An identity pool ID in the format REGION:GUID.

nested_items.name: IdentityPoolId
nested_items.description: An identity pool ID in the format REGION:GUID.

nested_items.name: AllowUnauthenticatedIdentities
nested_items.description: TRUE if the identity pool supports unauthenticated logins.

nested_items.name: AllowClassicFlow
nested_items.description: Enables or disables the Basic (Classic) authentication flow. For more information, see Identity Pools (Federated Identities) Authentication Flow in the Amazon Cognito Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: SupportedLoginProviders
nested_items.description: Optional key:value pairs mapping provider names to provider app IDs.

nested_items.name: DeveloperProviderName
nested_items.description: The 'domain' by which Cognito will refer to your users.

nested_items.name: OpenIdConnectProviderARNs
nested_items.description: The ARNs of the OpenID Connect providers.

nested_items.name: CognitoIdentityProviders
nested_items.description: A list representing an Amazon Cognito user pool and its client ID.

nested_items.name: ProviderName
nested_items.description: The provider name for an Amazon Cognito user pool. For example, cognito-idp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/us-east-1_123456789.

nested_items.name: ClientId
nested_items.description: The client ID for the Amazon Cognito user pool.

nested_items.name: ServerSideTokenCheck
nested_items.description: TRUE if server-side token validation is enabled for the identity provider's token.

nested_items.name: SamlProviderARNs
nested_items.description: An array of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the SAML provider for your identity pool.

nested_items.name: IdentityPoolTags
nested_items.description: The tags that are assigned to the identity pool. A tag is a label that you can apply to identity pools to categorize and manage them in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria.
